metadata.Title: CVE-2016-1531 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Exim before 4.86.2, when installed setuid root, allows local users to gain privileges via the perl_startup argument.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-1531` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-base - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-config - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
exim4-daemon-light - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
eximon4 - 4.82-3ubuntu2.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: mdeslaur> patches introduce behaviour change that my break existing setups must also ship two follow-up patches: 1- Don't issue env warning if env is empty 2- Store the initial working directory

criterions.comment: exim4 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.82-3ubuntu2.1').
